title: DACSS 604 Final Project
text:
State Standards Mastery Summary


Code
ELA_Standards<-read_csv("data_604/State_Standards-_Mastery_Star_2425_ELA.csv")%>%
  mutate(Division = case_when(
    Grade == 9 | Grade == 10 ~ "HS",
    Grade == 5 | Grade == 6 | Grade == 7 | Grade == 8 ~ "MS"  
  ))%>%
  mutate(Grade = as.factor(Grade))%>%
  
  mutate(`Reporting Category` = as.factor(`Reporting Category`))%>%
  mutate(`Domain` = as.factor(`Domain`))%>%
  mutate(`Division` = as.factor(`Division`))%>%
  mutate(`Screening Window` = as.factor(`Screening Window`))%>%
mutate(`Text Type` = as.factor(`Text Type`))
  

ELA_Standards

title: DACSS 604 Final Project
text:
Growth/Demographic Summary


Code
star_dem_all_private<-read_csv("data_604/student_star_dem_all_private.csv")%>%
  mutate(`Grade` = as.factor(`Grade`))%>%
  mutate(`Grade` = recode_factor(`Grade`,
                                              "5" = "5",
                                              "6" = "6",
                                              "7" = "7",
                                              "8"= "8",
                                              "9"= "9",
                                              "10"= "10",
                                              .ordered = TRUE))%>%
  mutate(School_Year = as.factor(School_Year))%>%
   mutate(School_Year = recode_factor(School_Year,
                              "2023-2024" = "2023-2024",
                              "2024-2025" = "2024-2025",
                              .ordered = TRUE))%>%
  mutate(`Assignment Type` = as.factor(`Assignment Type`))%>%
  mutate(`Test 1 Benchmark Category` = recode_factor(`Test 1 Benchmark Category`,
                                              "At/Above Benchmark" = "At/Above Benchmark",
                                              "On Watch" = "On Watch",
                                              "Intervention" = "Intervention",
                                              "Urgent Intervention"= "Urgent Intervention",
                                              .ordered = TRUE))%>%
  mutate(IEP_Status = as.factor(IEP_Status))%>%
  mutate(`504_Status` = as.factor(`504_Status`))%>%
  mutate(`Low_Income_Status` = as.factor(Low_Income_Status))%>%
  mutate(`Gender` = as.factor(Gender) )%>%
  mutate(`Gender_Status` = case_when(
    Gender == "Male" ~ 0,
    Gender == "Female" ~ 1
  ))

star_dem_all_private

title: DACSS 604 Final Project
text:
Historical Summary Data Frames


Code
HistSchoolBenchSum<-read_csv("data_604/StarBenchmarkSummary_School.csv")%>% 
  mutate(Year = as.factor(Year))%>%
  mutate(`Screening Window` = as.factor(`Screening Window`))%>%
  mutate(`Benchmark_Status` = recode_factor(`Benchmark_Status`,
                                              "At/Above Benchmark" = "At/Above Benchmark",
                                              "Below Benchmark" = "Below Benchmark",
                                              .ordered = TRUE))%>%
  select(Year, `Screening Window`, Subject, `Benchmark_Status`, `% Students`)

HistSchoolBenchSum



  



Code
HistGradeGrowthSum<-read_csv("data_604/StarBenchmarkSummary_SGP_Sum.csv")%>%
  mutate(Year = as.factor(Year))%>%
  mutate(`Screening Window` = as.factor(`Screening Window`))%>%
  mutate(`Subject` = as.factor(`Subject`))%>%
  mutate(`Grade` = as.factor(Grade))%>%
  mutate(`Grade` = recode_factor(`Grade`,
                                              "Grade 5" = "Grade 5",
                                              "Grade 6" = "Grade 6",
                                              "Grade 7" = "Grade 7",
                                              "Grade 8"= "Grade 8",
                                              "Grade 9"= "Grade 9",
                                              "Grade 10"= "Grade 10",
                                              .ordered = TRUE))%>%
  select(Year, `Screening Window`, `Grade`, Subject, `Median SGP`)

title: DACSS 604 Final Project
text:
Historical Benchmark_Status


Code
star_dem_all_private<-star_dem_all_private%>%
  mutate(Benchmark_Status = 
           case_when(`Test 1 PR` >= 40 ~ "At/Above Benchmark",
                     `Test 1 PR` < 40 ~ "Below Benchmark"))%>%
  mutate(Benchmark_Status = as.factor(Benchmark_Status))



Statistical Test

Acheivement: Math


Code
star_dem_math<- star_dem_all_private%>%
  filter(`Assignment Type` == "Star Math")
fit_Math_achieve = lm(`Test 1 PR` ~ School_Year + `IEP_Status`, data = star_dem_math)

summary(fit_Math_achieve)



Call:
lm(formula = `Test 1 PR` ~ School_Year + IEP_Status, data = star_dem_math)

Residuals:

-61.191 -17.191   1.701  18.453  69.453

IEP_Status1   -32.7515     1.7054 -19.205   <2e-16 ***
---

F-statistic: 187.3 on 2 and 958 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16

title: 2024-2025 Grade 5 Mathematics Initiative
text:
What questions will we examine?

Is there a relationship between Rising Tide’s 2024-2025 Grade 5 Mathematics programming initiatives and Grade 5 student growth in mathematics?
Why?

In the Spring of 2022, 2023, and 2024, Rising Tide Grade 5 math students’ average growth percentiles on the MCAS were considerably below the state average of 50; 75% of students were below the 25th percentile for growth in 20231


Source: Rising Tide 2023 Accountability Report

title: 2024-2025 Grade 5 Mathematics Initiative
text:
What Changes did we Make?

Schedule: Increase instructional hours dedicated to math in Grade 5
Instruction: Train teachers on the use of the G5 Math curricular materials

title: A Rising Tide Lifts all Boats?
text:
What did we observe?

Grade 5 students with the same Test 1 achievement percentile, disability status, and income status are predicted to have an SGP 10 percentiles higher in SY2024-2025 than in SY2023-2024.

title: 2024-2025 Grade 5 Mathematics Initiative
text:
What Changes did we make? (cont.)

Alignment


- Provide Department level training on the use of the G5 Math curricular materials
    - Provide template for the use of time in a 55 minute block
    - Set clear expectations on frequency of assessment and use of team-written assessments
    - Provide bank of ***High Quality, supplemental resources*** for numeracy


- Provide District-level, standards aligned assessments, 2 weeks after each unit, for analysis

title: 2024-2025 Grade 5 Mathematics Initiative
text:
What Changes did we Make?




Schedule

Provide a year-long course calendar mapping of lessons
Move 4 units from the G5 Math course to the G5 STEM course




Alignment

Provide Department level training on the use of the G5 Math curricular materials

Provide template for the use of time in a 55 minute block
Set clear expectations on frequency of assessment and use of team-written assessments
Provide bank of High Quality, supplemental resources for numeracy

Provide District-level, standards aligned assessments, 2 weeks after each unit, for analysis

title: A Rising Tide Lifts all Boats?
section: What about our students on IEPs?
text:
What about our students on IEPs?

In SY2024-2025 the difference between the median SGP of students on IEPs and their non-disabled peers was 10 percentiles, less than half the difference in SY2023-2024 of 24 percentiles.

title: 2024-2025 Grade 5 Mathematics Initiative
text:
Achievement: PR

Achievement Percentile (PR)

Continuous, with minimum value of 1 and maximum value of 99
A student with a PR of 54 scored better than 54% of students in their grade level.
A student is classified as At/Above Benchmark if their achievement percentile is at least 40.

title: 2024-2025 Grade 5 Mathematics Initiative
text:
Growth: SGP

Student Growth Percentile (SGP)

Measure of a student’s improvement given their achievement on their first test.
Continuous with minimum value of 1 and maximum value of 99
A student with an SGP of 54 improved more than 54% of students in their grade level who had similar achievement on their first screening test.

title: A Rising Tide Lifts all Boats?
text:
Test Achievement Percentile: PR

Minimum value of 1 and maximum value of 99
A student with a PR of 54 scored higher than 54% of students in their grade level.
A student is classified as At/Above Benchmark for their grade level if their achievement percentile is at least 40.

title: A Rising Tide Lifts all Boats?
text:
Student Growth Percentile: SGP

Measure of a student’s improvement compared to national peers with the same achievement percentile rank on their first test.





Gretchen Walsh set a new world record of 22.83 seconds in December 2024; swimming 1.5 seconds faster than her Paris Olympic race
My 8 year old, novice swimmer shave 19 seconds off of his 50 freestyle in December 2024; this growth is expected
A student with an SGP of 54 improved more than 54% of students in their grade level who had the same achievement on their first screening test.
